CreateTrail.documentation:
From the command line, use ``create-subscription``. 

 Creates a trail that specifies the settings for delivery of log data to an Amazon S3 bucket.

DescribeTrails.documentation: Retrieves settings for the trail associated with the current region for your account.

GetTrailStatus.documentation: Returns a JSON-formatted list of information about the specified trail. Fields include information on delivery errors, Amazon SNS and Amazon S3 errors, and start and stop logging times for each trail.

LookupEvents.documentation:
Looks up API activity events captured by CloudTrail that create, update, or delete resources in your account. Events for a region can be looked up for the times in which you had CloudTrail turned on in that region during the last seven days. Lookup supports five different attributes: time range (defined by a start time and end time), user name, event name, resource type, and resource name. All attributes are optional. The maximum number of attributes that can be specified in any one lookup request are time range and one other attribute. The default number of results returned is 10, with a maximum of 50 possible. The response includes a token that you can use to get the next page of results. The rate of lookup requests is limited to one per second per account.

 Events that occurred during the selected time range will not be available for lookup if CloudTrail logging was not enabled when the events occurred.

StartLogging.documentation: Starts the recording of AWS API calls and log file delivery for a trail.

StopLogging.documentation: Suspends the recording of AWS API calls and log file delivery for the specified trail. Under most circumstances, there is no need to use this action. You can update a trail without stopping it first. This action is the only way to stop recording.

UpdateTrail.documentation:
From the command line, use ``update-subscription``.

 Updates the settings that specify delivery of log files. Changes to a trail do not require stopping the CloudTrail service. Use this action to designate an existing bucket for log delivery. If the existing bucket has previously been a target for CloudTrail log files, an IAM policy exists for the bucket.

CloudWatchLogsDeliveryUnavailableExcepti.documentation: Cannot set a CloudWatch Logs delivery for this region.

CreateTrailRequest.documentation: Specifies the settings for each trail.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the trail.

members.name: S3BucketName
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket designated for publishing log files.

members.name: S3KeyPrefix
members.documentation: Specifies the Amazon S3 key prefix that precedes the name of the bucket you have designated for log file delivery.

members.name: SnsTopicName
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon SNS topic defined for notification of log file delivery.

members.name: IncludeGlobalServiceEvents
members.documentation: Specifies whether the trail is publishing events from global services such as IAM to the log files.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn
members.documentation: Specifies a log group name using an Amazon Resource Name (ARN), a unique identifier that represents the log group to which CloudTrail logs will be delivered. Not required unless you specify CloudWatchLogsRoleArn.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsRoleArn
members.documentation: Specifies the role for the CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user’s log group.

CreateTrailResponse.documentation: Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise, returns an error.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the trail.

members.name: S3BucketName
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket designated for publishing log files.

members.name: S3KeyPrefix
members.documentation: Specifies the Amazon S3 key prefix that precedes the name of the bucket you have designated for log file delivery.

members.name: SnsTopicName
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon SNS topic defined for notification of log file delivery.

members.name: IncludeGlobalServiceEvents
members.documentation: Specifies whether the trail is publishing events from global services such as IAM to the log files.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn
members.documentation: Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the log group to which CloudTrail logs will be delivered.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsRoleArn
members.documentation: Specifies the role for the CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user’s log group.

DeleteTrailRequest.documentation: The request that specifies the name of a trail to delete.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The name of a trail to be deleted.

DeleteTrailResponse.documentation: Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise, returns an error.

members.name: trailNameList
members.documentation: The trail returned.

DescribeTrailsResponse.documentation: Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise, returns an error.

members.name: trailList
members.documentation: The list of trails.

Event.documentation: Contains information about an event that was returned by a lookup request. The result includes a representation of a CloudTrail event.

members.name: EventId
members.documentation: The CloudTrail ID of the event returned.

members.name: EventName
members.documentation: The name of the event returned.

members.name: EventTime
members.documentation: The date and time of the event returned.

members.name: Username
members.documentation: A user name or role name of the requester that called the API in the event returned.

members.name: Resources
members.documentation: A list of resources referenced by the event returned.

members.name: CloudTrailEvent
members.documentation: A JSON string that contains a representation of the event returned.

GetTrailStatusRequest.documentation: The name of a trail about which you want the current status.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The name of the trail for which you are requesting the current status.

GetTrailStatusResponse.documentation: Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise, returns an error.

members.name: IsLogging
members.documentation: Whether the CloudTrail is currently logging AWS API calls.

members.name: LatestDeliveryError
members.documentation: Displays any Amazon S3 error that CloudTrail encountered when attempting to deliver log files to the designated bucket. For more information see the topic Error Responses in the Amazon S3 API Reference.

members.name: LatestNotificationError
members.documentation: Displays any Amazon SNS error that CloudTrail encountered when attempting to send a notification. For more information about Amazon SNS errors, see the Amazon SNS Developer Guide.

members.name: LatestDeliveryTime
members.documentation: Specifies the date and time that CloudTrail last delivered log files to an account's Amazon S3 bucket.

members.name: LatestNotificationTime
members.documentation: Specifies the date and time of the most recent Amazon SNS notification that CloudTrail has written a new log file to an account's Amazon S3 bucket.

members.name: StartLoggingTime
members.documentation: Specifies the most recent date and time when CloudTrail started recording API calls for an AWS account.

members.name: StopLoggingTime
members.documentation: Specifies the most recent date and time when CloudTrail stopped recording API calls for an AWS account.

members.name: LatestCloudWatchLogsDeliveryError
members.documentation: Displays any CloudWatch Logs error that CloudTrail encountered when attempting to deliver logs to CloudWatch Logs.

members.name: LatestCloudWatchLogsDeliveryTime
members.documentation: Displays the most recent date and time when CloudTrail delivered logs to CloudWatch Logs.

InsufficientS3BucketPolicyException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the policy on the S3 bucket is not sufficient.

InsufficientSnsTopicPolicyException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the policy on the SNS topic is not sufficient.

InvalidCloudWatchLogsLogGroupArnExceptio.documentation: This exception is thrown when the provided CloudWatch log group is not valid.

InvalidCloudWatchLogsRoleArnException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the provided role is not valid.

InvalidLookupAttributesException.documentation: Occurs when an invalid lookup attribute is specified.

InvalidMaxResultsException.documentation: This exception is thrown if the limit specified is invalid.

InvalidNextTokenException.documentation: Invalid token or token that was previously used in a request with different parameters. This exception is thrown if the token is invalid.

InvalidS3BucketNameException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the provided S3 bucket name is not valid.

InvalidS3PrefixException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the provided S3 prefix is not valid.

InvalidSnsTopicNameException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the provided SNS topic name is not valid.

InvalidTimeRangeException.documentation: Occurs if the timestamp values are invalid. Either the start time occurs after the end time or the time range is outside the range of possible values.

InvalidTrailNameException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the provided trail name is not valid.

LookupAttribute.documentation: Specifies an attribute and value that filter the events returned.

members.name: AttributeKey
members.documentation: Specifies an attribute on which to filter the events returned.

members.name: AttributeValue
members.documentation: Specifies a value for the specified AttributeKey.

members.name: LookupAttributes
members.documentation: Contains a list of lookup attributes. Currently the list can contain only one item.

members.name: StartTime
members.documentation: Specifies that only events that occur after or at the specified time are returned. If the specified start time is after the specified end time, an error is returned.

members.name: EndTime
members.documentation: Specifies that only events that occur before or at the specified time are returned. If the specified end time is before the specified start time, an error is returned.

members.name: MaxResults
members.documentation: The number of events to return. Possible values are 1 through 50. The default is 10.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The token to use to get the next page of results after a previous API call. This token must be passed in with the same parameters that were specified in the the original call. For example, if the original call specified an AttributeKey of 'Username' with a value of 'root', the call with NextToken should include those same parameters.

LookupEventsResponse.documentation: Contains a response to a LookupEvents action.

members.name: Events
members.documentation: A list of events returned based on the lookup attributes specified and the CloudTrail event. The events list is sorted by time. The most recent event is listed first.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The token to use to get the next page of results after a previous API call. If the token does not appear, there are no more results to return. The token must be passed in with the same parameters as the previous call. For example, if the original call specified an AttributeKey of 'Username' with a value of 'root', the call with NextToken should include those same parameters.

MaximumNumberOfTrailsExceededException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the maximum number of trails is reached.

Resource.documentation: Specifies the type and name of a resource referenced by an event.

members.name: ResourceType
members.documentation: The type of a resource referenced by the event returned. When the resource type cannot be determined, null is returned. Some examples of resource types are: Instance for EC2, Trail for CloudTrail, DBInstance for RDS, and AccessKey for IAM. For a list of resource types supported for event lookup, see Resource Types Supported for Event Lookup.

members.name: ResourceName
members.documentation: The name of the resource referenced by the event returned. These are user-created names whose values will depend on the environment. For example, the resource name might be "auto-scaling-test-group" for an Auto Scaling Group or "i-1234567" for an EC2 Instance.

ResourceList.documentation: A list of resources referenced by the event returned.

S3BucketDoesNotExistException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the specified S3 bucket does not exist.

StartLoggingRequest.documentation: The request to CloudTrail to start logging AWS API calls for an account.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The name of the trail for which CloudTrail logs AWS API calls.

StartLoggingResponse.documentation: Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise, returns an error.

StopLoggingRequest.documentation: Passes the request to CloudTrail to stop logging AWS API calls for the specified account.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: Communicates to CloudTrail the name of the trail for which to stop logging AWS API calls.

StopLoggingResponse.documentation: Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise, returns an error.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: Name of the trail set by calling CreateTrail.

members.name: S3BucketName
members.documentation: Name of the Amazon S3 bucket into which CloudTrail delivers your trail files.

members.name: S3KeyPrefix
members.documentation: Value of the Amazon S3 prefix.

members.name: SnsTopicName
members.documentation: Name of the existing Amazon SNS topic that CloudTrail uses to notify the account owner when new CloudTrail log files have been delivered.

members.name: IncludeGlobalServiceEvents
members.documentation: Set to True to include AWS API calls from AWS global services such as IAM. Otherwise, False.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn
members.documentation: Specifies an Amazon Resource Name (ARN), a unique identifier that represents the log group to which CloudTrail logs will be delivered.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsRoleArn
members.documentation: Specifies the role for the CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user’s log group.

TrailAlreadyExistsException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the specified trail already exists.

TrailNotFoundException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the trail with the given name is not found.

UpdateTrailRequest.documentation: Specifies settings to update for the trail.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the trail.

members.name: S3BucketName
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket designated for publishing log files.

members.name: S3KeyPrefix
members.documentation: Specifies the Amazon S3 key prefix that precedes the name of the bucket you have designated for log file delivery.

members.name: SnsTopicName
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon SNS topic defined for notification of log file delivery.

members.name: IncludeGlobalServiceEvents
members.documentation: Specifies whether the trail is publishing events from global services such as IAM to the log files.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn
members.documentation: Specifies a log group name using an Amazon Resource Name (ARN), a unique identifier that represents the log group to which CloudTrail logs will be delivered. Not required unless you specify CloudWatchLogsRoleArn.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsRoleArn
members.documentation: Specifies the role for the CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user’s log group.

UpdateTrailResponse.documentation: Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise, returns an error.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the trail.

members.name: S3BucketName
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket designated for publishing log files.

members.name: S3KeyPrefix
members.documentation: Specifies the Amazon S3 key prefix that precedes the name of the bucket you have designated for log file delivery.

members.name: SnsTopicName
members.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon SNS topic defined for notification of log file delivery.

members.name: IncludeGlobalServiceEvents
members.documentation: Specifies whether the trail is publishing events from global services such as IAM to the log files.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn
members.documentation: Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the log group to which CloudTrail logs will be delivered.

members.name: CloudWatchLogsRoleArn
members.documentation: Specifies the role for the CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user’s log group.
